Class main.WalkableTile

java.lang.Object
main.Tile
main.WalkableTile
public class main.WalkableTile extends main.Tile
Represents a tile that the main.Hero can walk on. This tile is always destructible and initially walkable.

In the context of bomberman-style mechanics, a walkable tile may be temporarily set to non-walkable when a bomb is placed on top of it, preventing the main.Hero from occupying the same tile until the bomb explodes. After the explosion, it becomes walkable again.

    • isWalkable

      public boolean isWalkable()
      Indicates whether this tile can be walked on by the main.Hero.
      Specified by:
      isWalkable in class main.Tile
      Returns:
      true if the tile allows movement, false otherwise

    • setWalkable

      public void setWalkable(boolean walkability)
      Updates the walkability of this tile.

      This is commonly used when a bomb is placed on the tile. The tile becomes temporarily non-walkable so that the main.Hero cannot move back onto it, mimicking traditional Bomberman movement rules. After the bomb explodes, the tile may be restored to walkable status by using this method and setting back walkability to true.

      Specified by:
      setWalkable in class main.Tile
      Parameters:
      walkability - true if the tile should become walkable again, false otherwise

    • getType

      public char getType()
      Returns the display character used to represent this tile on the board.
      Specified by:
      getType in class main.Tile
      Returns:
      a space character (' ') indicating a normal walkable tile
